text: Here's how to connect your AirPods
to a PC.

To do this, make sure
your AirPods are charged.
Click "Settings" from the start menu.
Then click "Devices."

Make sure that Bluetooth
is switched to on.
Click "Add Bluetooth or other device."
Then, in the "Add a device" window,
click "Bluetooth."

Now open your AirPods
case and press and hold
the small button on the back of the case
for several seconds.
For AirPod users with a Generation 1 case,

the light inside the case
will start blinking white.

For users of a Generation
2 case or AirPod Pros,
the light will be in front of the case
and will also start blinking white.
Your AirPods should now appear
on the list of devices
available for pairing on your PC.

Note they might appear
as "Headphones" at first
and then appear as AirPods.

Click "AirPods," and Windows
will display a message

that indicates you have
successfully connected your AirPods.
